DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine onset pain relief single dose acetaminophen ibuprofen subject experience postoperative dental pain follow surgical extraction least three molar .
DOC.brief_title: An Effectiveness Safety Study Acetaminophen 1000 mg Ibuprofen 400 mg Postoperative Dental Pain
DOC.detailed_description: The primary objective randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled study determine onset analgesia follow administration single dose 1000 mg acetaminophen , 400 mg ibuprofen placebo subject experience acute postoperative dental pain secondary surgical extraction least three molar , least one partial complete bony mandibular third molar impaction . After report moderate severe pain follow dental surgery , subject record baseline pain intensity treat single oral dose acetaminophen , ibuprofen , placebo . Subjects evaluate pain intensity pain relief relative baseline various timepoints 4 hour take study medication . Pain intensity assess use five-point scale consist none ( 0 ) , mild ( 1 ) , moderate ( 2 ) , moderately severe ( 3 ) , severe ( 4 ) . Pain relief baseline evaluate five-point scale consist none ( 0 ) , little ( 1 ) , ( 2 ) , lot ( 3 ) , complete ( 4 ) . At end first hour observation period time take supplemental analgesic medication ( rescue treatment ) , whichever occur first , subject make overall ( global ) assessment study medication , base five-point scale consist poor ( 0 ) , fair ( 1 ) , good ( 2 ) , good ( 3 ) , excellent ( 4 ) . Subjects require remain study site duration four-hour observation period . The primary efficacy assessment pain intensity difference baseline pain relief measurement time . Safety assess monitor adverse event occur throughout study . The primary hypothesis difference acetaminophen placebo ibuprofen placebo time point proportion subject report non-zero pain relief . The patient receive single oral dose one follow three treatment : Two acetaminophen 500 mg caplets two placebo ibuprofen capsule , two placebo acetaminophen caplets two ibuprofen 200 mg capsule , two placebo acetaminophen caplets two placebo ibuprofen capsule .
DOC.criteria: Indicates moderate severe pain follow extraction least three molar ( include least one partial complete bony mandibular third molar impaction ) weigh least 100 pound Body Mass Index ( BMI ) 18 28 take medication anxiety , depression schizophrenia female , pregnant breastfeeding Used ibuprofen acetaminophen within 12 hour precede surgery pain reliever antiinflammatory drug within 24 hour precede surgery gastrointestinal disease would interfere absorption excretion study medication unable swallow study medication whole significant medical condition history adverse reaction acetaminophen , ibuprofen anesthetic agent use extraction
